entries.content: Today I worked with objects and arrays and logging to the console.
I learned to use flexbox to style in CSS.
We started a group project building and designing a tribute website for John Legend.
Today I learned to set up repositories and push to master through the command line.

Today we began exploring JSON and working with Postman to make changes to our javaScript document and the DOM. I worked on my journal during labtime. Bryan helped me with syntax and troubleshooting the issues I was having. I feel like I left today with more confidence in myself as a blossoming web developer. I need to work on not trying to perfect everything, but allowing the process to take shape. Keep learning! Keep going.

We worked on a group projected called Welcome to Nashville, which I found to be very difficult. Several times I questioned whether, or not I belong at NSS. It seems like I should have retained more information by now, but my brain must have a leak. They keep telling me this is a normal part of the process. Little by little, I'm learning to accept the unknown and look for the answers.
I worked with Sarah Fleming to get my journal to save to my API and to render to the dom. This shit is confusing, but I'm figuring it out little by little as I go along.
I wish I could figure out how to do this all by myself. But holy shit!
